Leong Wen Fong, Economics and Management at University of LondonLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 08 Nov 2018This is a very general question, and it varies from comapny to company. However, there are a few things you can do - Stalk the CompanyIt reflects very badly on you if you don't know what the comapny does, or what your role is there. Basically shows that you are only in it for the money.Counter-interview the companyAs much as you want to ace the interview, it should never be a one-sided thing. You should also consider if the company is a good match for you, and whether it is inline with the goals you want (eg. learning a certain skill)All in all, just ensure that you err on the side of caution. Overdress if you are not sure what the dress code is.
